unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Uttar Pradesh**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Uttar Pradesh**

unnormalised: Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh – The Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) announced significant progress in the state's smart meter installation drive. As of 10/27/2023, over 2.5 million smart meters have been deployed across key urban and rural areas, including Kanpur and Prayagraj. This initiative aims to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (AT&C) losses, a major concern for discoms like Paschimanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam Limited (PVVNL).
normalised: Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh – The U P P C L announced significant progress in the state's smart meter installation drive. As of twenty seventh october two thousand and twenty three, over two point five million smart meters have been deployed across key urban and rural areas, including Kanpur and Prayagraj. This initiative aims to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, a major concern for discoms like Paschimanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam Limited (P V V N L).

unnormalised: The smart meters enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption, allowing consumers to track their usage patterns and make informed decisions. UPPCL anticipates a reduction in power theft and improved billing accuracy. "By Diwali (11/12/2023), we expect to see a discernible impact on revenue collection," stated a senior UPPCL official at a press conference held at 11:00 hrs today. The next phase focuses on integrating these meters with prepaid functionalities and expanding coverage to more remote districts. Further, the Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) is providing crucial technical support. The project, budgeted at Rs. 10,000 Crores, is expected to be completed by 31/12/2024.
